text: Cable type, rating (CMR/LSZH/Plenum), color, and termination types confirmed to match RFP/specs
Approved shop drawings showing cable routes, IDF/MDF locations, and quantities
Labeling scheme and numbering plan approved and consistent across drawings and racks
Cable supports (ladder tray, J-hooks, D-rings) installed with max spacing limits per BICSI/NEC
Cables run with no kinks, sharp bends, or unpermitted splices
Horizontal cable length does not exceed 90m from patch panel to outlet
Fiber optic cable installed in innerduct with correct bend radius and pull tension
Patch panels, jacks, and field terminations are punched down and labeled
Patch cords installed with strain relief; no tight bends at connectors
Rack layout neat with Velcro, lacing bars, cable managers installed
Proper grounding and bonding provided for racks and cable tray
Copper cable tested with Fluke/BERT for length, NEXT, return loss, and wiremap
Fiber tested with OTDR for insertion loss and length
Test reports submitted in PDF and original software formats
As-built drawings showing final cable routes and IDs provided
O&M documentation including test results, warranties, and cut-sheets submitted
